Package com.example.inventorymanager.ui.sort

Class SortOptionsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.inventorymanager.ui.sort.SortOptionsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class SortOptionsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
Manages the screen that enables users to choose sorting conditions. Users may choose filters based on the date the item was purchased, the make of the item, or keywords from the item's description.
Author:
Sumaiya Salsabil

    • onCreateView

      public android.view.View onCreateView(@NonNull android.view.LayoutInflater inflater, android.view.ViewGroup container, android.os.Bundle savedInstanceState)
      Provides the user interface of the fragment. Displays filtering information and enables users to change these conditions.
      Overrides:
      onCreateView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
      Parameters:
      inflater - The object used to inflate views as required.
      container - The parent view of the fragment.
      savedInstanceState - The previous state of the fragment; not used in this fragment.
      Returns:
      The root of the view.

    • sortItems

      public void sortItems(ArrayList<String> sortBys)
      Sorts the items in the `sortedItems` list based on the provided sort criteria. The function first creates a list of comparators based on the `sortBys` list, and then creates a composite comparator to perform multi-sorting.
      Parameters:
      sortBys - An ArrayList of strings representing the sorting criteria.

    • createComparator

      public static Comparator<Item> createComparator(String sortBy, boolean ascending)
      Creates a comparator based on the given sorting criteria and sorting order (ascending or descending). The sorting criteria can be "Date," "Description," "Make," or "Value," and the sorting order can be specified by the `ascending` parameter.
      Parameters:
      sortBy - A string representing the sorting criteria ("Date," "Description," "Make," or "Value").
      ascending - A boolean value indicating whether the sorting order is ascending (true) or descending (false).
      Returns:
      A comparator function for the specified sorting criteria and order.
      Throws:
      ParseException - if an error occurs while parsing dates.

    • onDestroyView

      public void onDestroyView()
      Destroys the fragment.
      Overrides:
      onDestroyView in class androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
